header.disclaimer: This is a preview version: some features may be incomplete.
header.title: What is SDW?
header.slogan: Sports Data-WareHouse, aka SDW, is an intelligent, scalable, centralized, unified repository of sports data, easily connectable to in-house or third-party platforms. SDW could synchronize and merge with any available data source. It as also able to provide a standardize (USDF) data set through an API that could be used by different clients.

links.title: General Information
links.noBookMarks: Hey! You do not have any bookmark
links.support_subtitle: Reach out to us for any questions or assistance. Our dedicated support team is ready to provide timely solutions and help you make the most of our services.

support.technicalSupportDescription: Our technical support team is here to assist you with any issues or challenges related to software functionality, troubleshooting, or system configurations. We will ensure your investment in our platform remains smooth and hassle-free.
support.feedbackDescription: We value your input! Share your feedback and suggestions with our support team, helping us improve our services and tailor our offerings to better meet your needs.
support.productInformationDescription: Unsure about our product offerings or how specific features can benefit you? Our knowledgeable team will provide comprehensive product information and help you choose the best solutions for your investment goals.
support.accountSecurityDescription: Your security is paramount. Our account security team will assist in safeguarding your information, preventing unauthorized access, and implementing best practices to ensure your data remains protected..
support.dataDescription: Leverage the expertise of our data and insights team to understand market trends, interpret data analytics, and gain valuable investment intelligence. Stay ahead of the curve with data-driven decision-making.
support.generalInquiriesDescription: For any other questions or concerns not covered in the above categories, our general inquiries support is here to provide prompt and reliable assistance.

links.security_subtitle: Missing any access? Your safety is our top priority. Rest easy knowing that our robust security measures ensure your data and information remain protected at all times.
links.documentation_subtitle: Explore our comprehensive documentation library, offering in-depth insights and step-by-step guides to leverage the full potential of our services with ease.
links.help_subtitle: Stuck or unsure? Access our extensive help resources, including FAQs and tutorials, to find quick answers and overcome any hurdles effortlessly.
links.catalog_subtitle: Browse, Discover, and Elevate Your Decision-Making with Our Comprehensive Catalog of Reports and Insights, Easily Accessible through Intuitive Search

message.trigger-new-ingestion: You are about to trigger a new {0} ingestion into SDW. The existing records will be deleted and replaced with fresh new values. Are you sure you want to proceed?

message.merge-instructions-1: Please select the <u>type</u> of deduplication and at least one <u>source</u> or a <u>set of disciplines</u>. The rest of the fields are optional, choose the right restrictions to increase the accuracy of the deduplication output.

consolidation.message_detach: This action will remove the selected element from the current merge. Are you sure you want to continue?
consolidation.message_split: This action will REVERT merging current and all included requests, set request status to 'Inactive' and return all original single entities to Production. Are you sure you want to continue?"
consolidation.message_cancel: This action will CANCEL the current merge and decouple all included entities. Are you sure you want to continue?
consolidation.message_reject: This action will CANCEL the current merge, save the combination as an exception so it will not be suggested again, and decouple all included entities. Are you sure you want to continue?
consolidation.message_confirm: This action will effectively TRIGGER the merge of all included entities. Are you sure you want to continue?
consolidation.message_update: This action will set update the fields visibility setup or the current merge request. Are you sure you want to continue?
consolidation.message_resolve: Empty value will be saved to PRODUCTION. Please, resolve manually in order to set relevant value.
consolidation.message_executionTime: The consolidation process may take from 1 to 3 minutes after saving. Please wait until the process is completed
consolidation.message_review: The {0} transformations match the internal data. It is strongly recommended to remove the transformations.
consolidation.message_noTransformations: The {0} has NO transformations: individual and production data are identical
consolidation.message_Transformations: The {0} has {1} transformations in place, no hidden fields
consolidation.message_HiddenTransformations: The {0} has {1} hidden fields and {2} transformations
consolidation.message_Hidden: The {0} has {1} hidden fields, no further transformations found
consolidation.message_ErrorInternal: <u>Consistency error</u>: There is no associated information in the INTERNAL layer so it could not be edited.
consolidation.message_ErrorProduction: <u>Consistency error</u>: There is no associated information in the PRODUCTION layer.

terms-of-use.title: Terms of Use for SDW Platform API and Web
terms-of-use.subtitle: These Terms of Use (the 'Terms') Olympic Channel Platforms, S.L.U. (“OCS”) set up the principles that rule the use of SDW Platform API and Web Service (the 'SDW Platform') and that must be abide at all times by any Users. By accessing or using the Platform, you agree to comply with and be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree with these Terms, do not use the Platform.

content.title: 1. Introduction
content.content: OCS offers a Platform that provides access to Olympic historical results and participant biographies since 1896, as well as comprehensive details on Olympic qualifying competitions such as World Championships, World Cups, etc.. The following Terms apply to all Users accessing the Platform, whether via API or Web, and any associated features.

content.title: 2. Generic obligations of Platform users
content: Nominate user: Access to the Platform is available only to users authorized by the Platform administrators based on the Request Access Form (“Users”). All Users must have valid credentials and explicit permission to use the Platform. Access is non-transferable, thus, you may not share or let others use your log-in details with anyone else. We may track your access and use of the Platform and keep records of what you search and export. We'll do this to check on performance of our systems and to check that you're sticking to these Terms. We might contact you to check you've got permission to use what you've exported or for administrative purposes. You are responsible for keeping your credentials, including API keys, secure. Unauthorized sharing or use of log-in details will result in suspension or termination of access.
Non-Transferable Access: The rights granted under these Terms are personal and non-transferable. You may not assign or transfer your rights to access or use the Platform to another party.

Access duration: The access is granted for a limited period of time, as requested in the Request Access Form. If the User no longer require access to the Platform, you must immediately notify SDW Platform support via email at sdw.support@olympicchannel.com.

Authorized User: Use the Platform only for the purposes that you've been approved to use it for, in accordance with the information contained in your Request Access Form. Your use is subject to all the limitations outlined in these Terms. If you have export permission, you must delete from your devices all the information that you've exported once your access terminates.

Non-Sharing of Data: Any data and information retrieved from the Platform is strictly confidential and may not be shared, distributed, or made accessible to third parties, unless explicitly allowed in writing by OCS. Unauthorized sharing of data will result in immediate termination of your access.

Notification for Termination: You must notify SDW support immediately if you are no longer using the API or wish to discontinue access. Upon termination, your access to the platform will be revoked, and you must stop using the Platform immediately.

Notification of High Usage: If you anticipate that your use of the Platform will involve massive data ingestion or high traffic during peak hours, you must notify SDW Platform Support in advance. This will ensure that the system can be adequately scaled to handle the load and avoid disruptions.

Peak Hours: You agree to work with SDW Platform Support to ensure smooth performance during periods of high demand. Failure to coordinate with SDW support could result in degraded performance or disruptions in service.
Data Handling: You agree that all data retrieved through the Platform will be handled in accordance with these Terms. You will not disclose, share, or misuse the data obtained from the Platform.

Prohibited Activities: You will not: i) use the Platform for any unauthorized, illegal, harmful, or malicious activities, including data scraping or harvesting; ii) reverse-engineer, decompile, or disassemble the Platform or any associated software; iii) attempt to bypass or disable any restrictions or security measures placed on access to the Platform; iv) use the Platform in a manner that may overload or disrupt its infrastructure; v) retrieve data from the Platform to create or compile, directly or indirectly, a collection, compilation, database, or directory without written permission from OCS; vi) upload or transmit to the Platform any viruses, trojan, spyware or similar software; vii) share your log-in credentials and any data or information within the Platform with third parties.

content.title: 3. Users’ obligation related to data protection
content: Compliance with data protection regulations: You agree to comply with all applicable data privacy laws and regulations when using the Platform and, in particular, with the principles and obligations set out in the GDPR. Any misuse of personal data, including data scraping, unauthorized access, or non-compliance with data privacy laws, is prohibited.

Confidentiality: You adhere to the principle of confidentiality and, therefore, you will not disclose personal data to what you have access while using the Platform to third parties in an unlawful manner.

Training: Participate in a timely manner in all personal data protection training activities aimed at their groups or departments and attend to the awareness-raising activities that are set in motion.

Incident Management: immediately inform the SDW Support of any incident that occurs in relation to the personal data. OCS will take appropriate disciplinary action in the event of failure to act with due diligence.

Storage media and document management: Storage media containing personal data must be i) clearly identified, ii) if reusable personal data must be erased before being reused; iii) stored in places to which unauthorized persons for the use of such personal data do not have access. If the documents containing personal data are not filed because they are in the process of being used or reviewed, the individual in charge of them must safeguard them and prevent them from being accessed by unauthorized persons at all time.

Prohibited acts: : i) Creation of personal databases without the corresponding authorization, ii) inclusion in the Platform of personal data without a legal basis and OCS’ approval; iii) use personal data for different purposes to those for which the personal data was collected, iv) crossing information related to personal data from different databases in order to perform a profiling when the corresponding legal authorization is not available.

content.title: 4. About the Platform
content: Uptime and Availability: While OCS will make reasonable efforts to ensure the availability and reliability of the Platform, there are no guarantees. The Platform may experience outages due to maintenance, network issues, or unforeseen circumstances.

Platform Interruptions: OCS reserves the right to suspend or limit access to the Platform for maintenance, security purposes, or in response to issues that threaten the integrity of the platform. Users will be notified of scheduled maintenance whenever possible.

Planned Maintenance or Downtime: OCS will notify Users in advance of any planned maintenance that may result in downtime. Users should plan accordingly and communicate any critical dependencies with SDW Support.

Access suspension or termination: OCS reserves the right to suspend or terminate your access to the Platform at any time, for any reason, including but not limited to violation of these Terms, security breaches, or unauthorized use.

content.title: 5. Changes to the Terms and OCS contact
content: Terms update: OCS reserves the right to modify or update these Terms at any time. Any changes will be communicated to Users by changing the “latest updated” date. If you continue accessing the Platform after such date, such access will constitute acceptance of the new Terms.
Support: For questions regarding these Terms or for any technical support, please contact SDW Platform Support at: sdw.support@olympicchannel.com
Access Request: For requesting access to the Platform, please fill-up our SDW Access Request Form.

content.title: 6. Data Protection
content: OCS will process your personal data as established OCS Corporate Privacy Policy. For any doubts, please contact the DPO at dpo@obs.tv.

license.title: Proprietary License Agreement for SDW Platform
license.subtitle: This Proprietary License Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into by and between Olympic Channel Services, the owner of the SDW Platform ("Licensor"), and the licensee ("License"), who wishes to access and use the SDW Platform and its associated API, services, and data.
license.subtitle2: By accessing or using the SDW Platform (the "Platform") or its services, the Licensee agrees to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement. If the Licensee does not agree to these terms, they must immediately cease all use of the Platform.

content.title: 1. License Grant
content: Proprietary License: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Licensor grants the Licensee a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to access and use the SDW Platform solely for the internal purposes specified in the accompanying documentation.

Restricted Use: The Licensee may not distribute, sublicense, lease, rent, or sell the Platform or any part thereof to any third party, nor may the Licensee permit others to do so. Access to the Platform is provided on a limited basis, and it may not be shared with unauthorized users.

content.title: 2. Ownership and Intellectual Property
content: Ownership: The SDW Platform, including all associated APIs, data, content, documentation, and software, is the exclusive property of Olympic Channel Services. The Licensee acknowledges that the Platform is licensed, not sold, and that no ownership rights are transferred under this Agreement.

Intellectual Property: All intellectual property rights, including copyrights, patents, trademarks, and trade secrets, related to the SDW Platform and its components, remain solely with Olympic Channel Services. The Licensee shall not reverse engineer, decompile, or otherwise attempt to derive the source code of the Platform.

content.title: 3. Restrictions
content: Non-Transferability: The Licensee’s access to the Platform is personal, and the license is non-transferable. The Licensee may not assign or transfer its rights under this Agreement to any third party, including any affiliate, subsidiary, or another legal entity.

Non-Sharing: The Licensee agrees not to share, lend, lease, or transfer any part of the Platform, including the API, user credentials, or any data obtained through the Platform, without prior written consent from the Licensor.
Prohibited Activities: The Licensee agrees not to:
list: Use the Platform for illegal activities or in violation of applicable laws.
Use the Platform for any commercial purpose without express written consent from Olympic Channel Services.
Engage in data scraping, harvesting, or other unauthorized data extraction methods.
Modify or create derivative works of the Platform or its components.

content.title: 4. Service and Access
content: Access to the Platform: Olympic Channel Services grants the Licensee access to the Platform in accordance with this Agreement. Access is provided through an API or web interface, as specified by the Licensor.

Availability: The Licensor will make reasonable efforts to ensure the availability of the Platform. However, the Licensor does not guarantee uptime and may suspend access for maintenance, upgrades, or unforeseen issues.

content.title: 5. Termination
content: Termination by Licensor: The Licensor may terminate this Agreement immediately upon notice if the Licensee breaches any term of this Agreement, including failure to comply with the restrictions on use or intellectual property rights.
Termination by Licensee: The Licensee may terminate this Agreement at any time by notifying Olympic Channel Services in writing and discontinuing all use of the Platform.

Effect of Termination: Upon termination of this Agreement, the Licensee must cease using the Platform and destroy or return any copies of the Platform and documentation in their possession. Any obligations accrued prior to termination will survive.

content.title: 6. Confidentiality
content: Confidential Information: The Licensee acknowledges that the Platform contains proprietary and confidential information. The Licensee agrees not to disclose, distribute, or use such confidential information except as necessary to exercise rights under this Agreement.
Protection of Data: The Licensee agrees to implement reasonable safeguards to protect the confidentiality and integrity of any data retrieved from the Platform.

content.title: 7. Liability and Indemnification
content: Limitation of Liability: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Olympic Channel Services shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of the use or inability to use the Platform, including but not limited to loss of data, profits, or business interruptions.

Indemnification: The Licensee agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Olympic Channel Services, its affiliates, and its employees from any claims, damages, or liabilities arising from the Licensee’s use of the Platform, including any violation of this Agreement or infringement of third-party rights.

content.title: 8. Compliance with Laws
content.content: The Licensee agrees to comply with all applicable laws, including data privacy and intellectual property laws, in connection with the use of the Platform. The Licensee is responsible for obtaining any necessary licenses, permissions, or consents to use the Platform as permitted by this Agreement.

content.title: 9. Modification and Amendments
content.content: The Licensor reserves the right to modify or amend this Agreement at any time. Any changes will be communicated to the Licensee, and continued use of the Platform after such modifications will constitute acceptance of the new terms.

content.title: 10. Contact Information
content: For questions regarding these Terms or for any technical support, please contact SDW Platform Support at: sdw.support@olympicchannel.com
For requesting access to the SDW Platform, please fill-out our SDW Access Request Form

contact.title: Contact SDW Team
contact.subtitle: We’re here to assist you! If you have any questions, issues, or feedback regarding the SDW Platform or need support, feel free to reach out to us. We’re happy to help you.

content.title: Support Team
content.content: For any technical inquiries, issues, troubleshooting, or assistance with your credentials or access, please contact our support team. We strive to respond to all requests as quickly as possible
content.footer: For more specific requests, such as API access or account assistance, please fill out the SDW Access Request Form to help us address your issue efficiently.

content.title: General and Partnership Inquiries
content.content: For general questions about the SDW Platform, or if you're interested in exploring any collaboration-related matters, please reach out to our Product team
list: Business Hours: Monday - Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM (UTC+2)

content.title: Feedback and Suggestions
content.content: We always welcome feedback! If you have suggestions for improving our platform or ideas on how we can serve you better, don’t hesitate to let our Product team know:
list: Business Hours: Monday - Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM (UTC+2)

security.title: Security and Account Management
security.subtitle: Your security and privacy are our top priority. If you encounter any issues with your account, need assistance with your current user status, or wish to request account deletion, we're here to help. Simply use the form below or contact us directly, and our team will take prompt action to resolve your concerns.
security.subtitle2: Your peace of mind is important to us, and we are committed to ensuring a safe and secure experience for all our users.

content.title: Common User Issues
content: Need Access? If you need a Web or API user or update the existing one, please reach out to us using the form below.
Account Access Problems: If you’re having trouble logging in or accessing your account, please reach out to us by the support email address
Account Deletion: If you would like to delete your account, please submit a request through the support email address, and we’ll process it promptly.
Security Concerns: If you suspect any security issues, such as unauthorized access to your account, please contact us immediately.

content.title: How to Request Assistance:
content: Contact Us Directly: For urgent matters, feel free to contact our support team directly at sdw.support@olympicchannel.com
Use the Form: Complete the SDW Access Request Form. Our team will get back to you as soon as possible.

documentation.intro: Hello and welcome! 👋 This is your go-to place for everything you need to know about SDW. Whether you're a developer, analyst, or just curious, you'll find clear and structured guides to help you navigate our platform.

content.title: What You’ll Find Here
content: ✅ API Documentation – Learn how to integrate with our services effortlessly.
✅ Guides & Tutorials – Step-by-step instructions for common use cases.
✅ Best Practices – Optimize your experience with expert recommendations.
✅ FAQs & Troubleshooting – Quick answers to common questions.

footerContent.title: 💡 Need Help?
footerContent.content: If you have any questions, feel free to explore our documentation or reach out to our support team. We’re here to help! 😃

welcome-intro: Sport Data Warehouse (SDW) is your central hub for trusted, structured, and accessible sports data. Whether you’re diving into historical records or tracking real-time updates during the Olympic Games, SDW brings it all to your fingertips.
what-it-is-content: The Sport Data Warehouse (SDW) is a robust platform built to simplify access to rich, reliable sports data.

From every edition of the Olympic Games since 1896 — Summer, Winter, and Youth — to qualifier events since 2021, SDW consolidates decades of information into one user-friendly space. Designed for both technical and non-technical users, it helps you explore, analyze, and understand sports data with ease.
what-content: SDW offers a wide array of features that cater to the unique requirements of sports organizations. With SDW, you can:

📌 Data Explorer: Gain insights with a clean, intuitive interface that lets you navigate through decades of Olympic history. View results, aggregated statistics, and data visualizations in just a few clicks.

📌 API Access: Our flexible APIs offer structured and raw data, with advanced filtering options. Perfect for developers, analysts, or organisation looking to integrate official data seamlessly into their own tools and platforms.

📌 Live Data Processing: During the Olympic Games, SDW processes the Olympic Data Feed (ODF) in real-time. This internal feature delivers live, structured data through a dedicated API—removing the complexity of building custom data processors.

📌 Sport Widgets: Embeddable and customizable widgets that brings sports data to life through interactive visualizations. Easily integrate it into your platform to display real-time stats, player insights, and more — all tailored to match your brand.
feature1-content: Navigate through decades of Olympic history with a clean, intuitive interface designed for effortless exploration.

From detailed event results to aggregated statistics and interactive data visualizations, uncover insights, spot trends, and compare performances across nations and athletes — all in just a few clicks.
feature2-content: Our flexible APIs deliver both structured and raw sports data, complete with advanced filtering and query capabilities to suit a wide range of needs.

Whether you're a developer building custom dashboards, an analyst digging into performance metrics, or an organization integrating official data into internal tools or public-facing platforms, our APIs provide a seamless and reliable way to access high-quality, real-time information with precision and control.
feature3-content: Bring your sports data to life with our widgets: powerful and fully embeddable tools that lets you integrate rich, interactive sports visualizations into your platform in just a few clicks.
Whether you're showcasing rankings, or historical results, our widget offers real-time visuals, responsive design, and deep customization options to match your brand and audience.
feature4-content: Stay updated with real-time data during events, ensuring you have the most accurate and timely information at your fingertips

syncAlert.title: Sync Status
syncAlert.message: Sync happens only when the analytical mode is on, global sync is enabled, no sync is running, the last sync is older than the last DB write, at least 5 minutes passed since last write, the last sync was within 30 minutes, and no active writes are happening.

global-setup.flag-cannot-changed: This flag cannot be changed directly.
global-setup.are-you-sure-you-want-to: Are you sure you want to
global-setup.global-redirect-note: Remember that if an individual setting for a service doesn't exist - the system will take the global value
global-setup.view-sync-is-currently-in-progress: View sync is currently in progress.
global-setup.disabled-message: This flag cannot be modified currently because the overall status does not satisfy the necessary conditions for the change
global-setup.sync-could-start-title: ✅ Synchronization can be started at any moment
global-setup.sync-could-start: Analytical/Automatic mode is active, Global Sync is enabled, no sync is currently running, recent data writes allow a safe sync, and all timing conditions are met.

security-manager.title: Security Manager
security-manager.description: Manage security settings, user access, and API clients for the SDW Platform.

note.title: Note
note.nominative: The user must be nominative, except for testing purposes. Full name and email are mandatory.
note.password: The password will be automatically generated and sent to the provided email address.
note.client-id: The client ID ideally should be nominative or at least provide the main contact person or responsible individual.
note.client-secret: The client secret will be automatically generated and sent to the provided email address.

hints.username: It will be used to log in. You can use a full email address or just the part before the @ symbol (e.g., 'john.doe' from 'john.doe@example.com').
hints.email: A valid email address where the password will be sent. It must belong to the owner of this user account.
hints.clientName: Client ID used to log in. It can be any string or email, but it should be unique and descriptive (e.g., 'my-app', 'data-processor').
hints.clientEmail: Email of the main contact person or responsible individual.

analyticModeEnabled.label: Analytic Mode
analyticModeEnabled.description: Specifies if the analytical database (real-time MV) is enabled. When disabled, fallback to Postgres materialized views is used.

productionModeEnabled.label: Production Mode
productionModeEnabled.description: Specifies if the Production Postgres database is enabled

isViewSyncActive.label: View Sync Active
isViewSyncActive.description: Indicates whether real-time synchronization of materialized views between the analytical database and Postgres is currently running.

isGlobalViewSyncEnabled.label: Global View Sync
isGlobalViewSyncEnabled.description: Indicates whether real-time synchronization of materialized views between the analytical database and Postgres is enabled.

isDataWriteActive.label: Data Write Active
isDataWriteActive.description: Indicates whether database writing is currently running.

usdmCacheEnabled.label: USDM Cache
usdmCacheEnabled.description: Indicates if the USDM cache is enabled.

isDataIngestActive.label: Data Ingest Active
isDataIngestActive.description: Indicates whether data ingestion is currently active.

dataWriteAge.label: Data Write Age
dataWriteAge.description: The age of the latest DB data write operations.

viewSyncCheckpointAge.label: Sync Checkpoint Age
viewSyncCheckpointAge.description: The age of the most recent successful synchronization.

viewEventAge.label: View Event Age
viewEventAge.description: Age of the last view event in the system.

automaticModeEnabled.label: Automatic Mode
automaticModeEnabled.description: Auto-switching to the analytical database is suspended if the latest data write is more recent than the last view sync event.

canUseProduction.label: Can Use Production
canUseProduction.description: Indicates if production mode can be used.

shouldUseProduction.label: Should Use Production
shouldUseProduction.description: Indicates if production mode should be used.

isDataWriteEnabled.label: Data Write Enabled
isDataWriteEnabled.description: When enable USDM Publisher is allowed to continue writing into the database.

access-request.title: SDW Platform Access Request
access-request.requirement-warning: Access is granted based on your role and the specific requirements of your tasks. Please provide detailed information about your access needs to help us assign the appropriate permissions.
access-request.fillup-form: To gain access please complete the following form.
access-request.data-restrictions-title: Which discipline, country, source or competition category do you need access to?
access-request.startDate: Start date for your API / UI access
access-request.endDate: End date for your API / UI access
access-request.typeContext: On which basis are you requesting access?
access-request.typeContext-hint: e.g. collaboration agreement, services agreement, etc.
access-request.purpose: What is the purpose of the API access?
access-request.purpose-hint: Please specify how you intend to use the API, such as data retrieval, analytics, integrations, or other specific use cases.
access-request.dataType: What type of data will you access?
access-request.operationType: Do you need access to specific features or modules within the platform?
access-request.operationType-hint: Please specify if you require access to particular features or modules within the platform to ensure we provide the appropriate permissions and resources.
access-request.peakUsage: Do you have specific peak usage times?
access-request.peakUsage-hint: If your API usage varies throughout the day, please indicate any peak periods to help us manage capacity and ensure optimal performance.
access-request.volumePerHour: Estimated volume of API calls per day or hour
access-request.volumePerHour-hint: Please provide an estimate of how many requests you expect to make per day or hour to help us optimize performance and ensure smooth access.
access-request.usageType: Will the API be accessed by a system, application, or individual users?
access-request.usageType-hint: If a system or application, please provide its name and details:
access-request.acceptTerms: You accept and agree with the SDW terms of use and OCS privacy
access-request.multiple: Is you request for multiple users?
access-request.category_hint: e.g. Olympic Games, World Championships, World Cups, Continental Championships
access-request.request-submitted: Hey! Your access request has been successfully submitted.
access-request.environments: Do you need access to any specific environment?
access-request.auto_process_warning: Note: Auto-process will try to generate the user/API client profiles automatically. They might be changed later on. If the user already exists, no changes will be made. You can also create/validate the profiles manually and just mark the status with the status buttons.
access-request.accepting-the-terms-message: You can not submit without accepting the terms.
